title: What is the difference between a junior high and a normal high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: Age. Junior high school is typically 6th thru 8th grade (nominally, 12 to 14 year old students) while high school is typically 9th through 12th grades (nominally, 14 through 18 year old students). Junior high schools arose out of a combination of factors, but mostly after the baby-boom of the 1940s and 50s stressed the school facilities of many towns…. less expensive to build a junior high school than to expand a bunch of smaller grade schools.

Junior highs will vary with the following different configurations: 7th & 8th grades7th, 8th, and 9th grades6th, 7th, and 8th gradesHigh School typically has only two configurations: 9th, 10th, 11th, and 12th grades.If the junior high is 7th, 8th, and 9th then the high school would be 10th, 11th, and 12th.
